intro: Adenocalymma friesianum, commonly known as the Friesian adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Adenocalymma friesianum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
